message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is about developing a neural abstractive summarization model that can generate high-quality summaries by interpreting the salient content semantically. The paper also introduces a novel evaluation scheme to measure the model's ability to identify off-topic information. Given the focus on natural language processing and machine learning, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also involves developing a neural model, which suggests that it could belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The evaluation scheme involves measuring the model's performance, which could fall under cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Finally, the paper's focus on improving the model's robustness against adversarial information suggests that it could also belong to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
